com.mixer.interactive.services

Class TransactionServiceProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mixer.interactive.services.AbstractServiceProvider
      • com.mixer.interactive.services.TransactionServiceProvider

  • public class TransactionServiceProvider
extends AbstractServiceProvider
    Provides all functionality relating to making requests and interpreting replies from the Interactive service regarding Spark transactions.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Microsoft Corporation
    See Also:
    InteractiveTransaction

    • Method Detail

      • capture

        public Boolean capture(String transactionID)
                throws InteractiveReplyWithErrorException,
                       InteractiveRequestNoReplyException
        Attempt to complete a spark transaction from the participant that initiated the transaction. The Interactive service makes a best-effort to validate the charge before it’s created, blocking obviously invalid ones outright, but when possible the client SHOULD await a successful reply before effecting any associated action.
        Parameters:
        transactionID - Identifier for a Spark transaction
        Returns:
        true if the transaction completed successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        InteractiveReplyWithErrorException - If the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError
        InteractiveRequestNoReplyException - If no reply is received from the Interactive service
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveControlInput, InteractiveTransaction

      • captureAsync

        public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<Boolean> captureAsync(String transactionID)

        Attempt to complete a spark transaction from the participant that initiated the transaction. The Interactive service makes a best-effort to validate the charge before it’s created, blocking obviously invalid ones outright, but when possible the client SHOULD await a successful reply before effecting any associated action.

        The result of the ListenableFuture may include checked exceptions that were thrown in the event that there was a problem with the reply from the Interactive service. Specifically, two types of checked exceptions may be thrown:

        • InteractiveRequestNoReplyException may be thrown if no reply is received from the Interactive service.
        • InteractiveReplyWithErrorException may be thrown if the reply received from the Interactive service contains an InteractiveError.

        Considerations should be made for these possibilities when interpreting the results of the returned ListenableFuture.

        Parameters:
        transactionID - Identifier for a Spark transaction
        Returns:
        A ListenableFuture that when complete returns true if the capture method call completes with no errors
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        InteractiveControlInput, InteractiveTransaction
